bibl.title: Francis Stephen Medcraf vs. Robert T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. 3038 Bond on Appeal.

KNOW ALL MEN by these Presents, that we, FRANCIS STEPHIN MEDCRAF as principal and John W. Rafferty adn Grace H. Rafferty his wife andElijah Le Roy Hollcroft and, Marjorie A. Hallcroft his wife as sureties, are held and firmly bound unto THE STATE OF WASHINGTON in the penal sum of TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($250.00) to be paid to the said State of Washington; for the payment of which well and truly to be made, we bind ourselves and each of us, our and each of our heirs, executors, administrators and successors, jointly and sevarally, firmly by these presents.
Sealed with our seals and dated this 30th day of September A. D. 1915.

WHEREAS, the above bounden FRANCIS STEPHIN MEDCRAF hasprosecuted ted as appeal to the Supreme court of the UNITED STATES to reverse the judgment rendered in the above entitled cause by the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, entered in said court on the 30th day of September A. D. 1915, denying the petition of the above named petitioner for a writ of habeas corpus and his discharge thereon and remanding him to the custody of the Sheriff of King County, Washington:

NOW THEREFORE, the condition of this obligation is such that if the above bounden FRANCIS STEPHIN MEDCRAF shall prosecute said appeal to effect and shall answer all damamges and costs if he shall fail to make said appeal good, then this obligation shall be void; otherwise the same shall be in full force and virture.
WITNESS:
div1.ab: Francis Stephen Medcraf. John W Rafferty Grace H. Rafferty Elijah LeRoy Hollcroft Marjorie A. Hollcroft
div1.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON SS COUNTY OF KING

BE IT KNOWN, that, on this 7th day of October A. D. 1915, before the undersigned, a Notary Public for Washington, duly commissioned and sworn, personally appeared FRANCIS STEPHIN MEDCRAF, John W. Rafferty and Grace H. Rafferty his wife and Elijah Le Roy Hollcroft and Marjorie A. Hollcroft his wife to me personally known to be the same persons named in and who executed the foregoing bond and they duly acknowledged to me that they executed the same freely and voluntarily and for the uses and purposes therein expressed.
Witness my hand and official seal this th day of October A. D. 1915.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
div1.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON SS COUNTY OF KING

John W. Rafferty and and Grace H. Rafferty his wife and Elijah Le Roy Hollcroft and, Marjorie A. Hollcroft his wife being first duly sworn, doth say; that they are the sureties name in and who executed the foregoing BOND; that they are residents and freeholders of the State of Washington and the respective communities which they comprise are each worth the sum of TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS, over and above their debts and liabilities and exclusive of their property exempt by law from sale on execution.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 7th day of October A. D. 1915.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
John W. Rafferty Grace H. Rafferty Elijah LeRoy Hollcroft Marjorie A. Hollcroft
div1.p: Approved 10-9-15
The within bond & approved Oct. 9th 1915 Judge
ORIGINAL No. 3038
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In Re application of F. S. Medcraf for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Bond on Appeal
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION OCT9-1915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By EMLakin Deputy 2x
div1.p: Geo. D. Emery Attorney for Appellant.
Telephone: Elliott 4606 419 Central Building SEATTLE, WASH.
At which office they consent that service of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them.
BULL BROS. "JUST PRINTERS"
